name: K2-58
scenarioDescription:
The K2-58 Exoplanetary System


Overview

K2-58 is a star with 0.89 times the mass of the Sun, and 0.86 times its radius. It is located 595.85 light years away from the solar system.

K2-58 is known to have 3 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the K2-58 system


K2-58 b

K2-58 b was discovered by the K2 observatory using the transit method. Its semi-major axis is 0.07 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The radius of K2-58 b is 2.68 that of Earth.


K2-58 c

K2-58 c was discovered by the K2 observatory using the transit method. Its semi-major axis is 0.04 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The radius of K2-58 c is 1.62 that of Earth.


K2-58 d

K2-58 d was discovered by the K2 observatory using the transit method. Its semi-major axis is 0.15 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The radius of K2-58 d is 1.71 that of Earth.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system K2-58, which contains 3 planets and was discovered by K2.
